page.title: 09Shops, Services & Industry
page.content: Smarden, has 2 pubs, a grocer's, a butchers and 2 antique shops, but visiting traders call with milk, fish, bread, groceries and fish & chips. Other non local services are coal delivery, laundry, window cleaning and chimney sweeping. The post office/shop pays pensions and allowances, sells cards, magazines, cigarettes and sweets, delivers newspapers, displays adverts. and is an important centre for village gossip and communications. Brickmaking has flourished in Pluckley for a century and seems likely to continue, using the plentiful reserves of local clay. Production of stock bricks is the main enterprise but craftsmen still practise hand throwing for special lines. The work force of 31 is a close knit community, often following family traditions in the trade.
